ygData.messageBody:
Well I really don't have any flames or cheers. I don't understand why you
were negative about his entire post though...seems to me you were picking it
apart, but that is just my opinion. I do have a couple of points.

Taunt: In my experience I have found that taunt works TOO well. I have
taunted so much that a mob has stayed on me no matter what anyone else did,
including the wizards high damage spell. If taunt doesn't seem to be
working in your party, something is not right. One thing. The person doing
the fetching is usually at the top of the list. If the wizard fetches and
then hits it for a high damaged spell, its going to be tough to get it off
him. I suggest letting the warrior go out with a bow and pull something.
Even if you miss the creature will still come after you.

Critical strike: I actually sent in a feedback on this skill. Here are the
points I made

1) Make it a skill the player has to invoked. The reasoning behind
this is you will see an opportunity when you can hit the creature for
more damage.
2) Make it recyclable, akin to the rogues backstab. You would not
be able to critcally hit and kick or bash in the same round.
3) Make it start at level 20, and only work with the first
weapon skill that reaches the point of 'master'. This would resemble a
specialization in that weapons category.
4) Damage: Make damage akin to the rogues backstab, something
like the skill divided by 2. So that at level 20 you would get 20 points
into critical strike. On a successful strike, you would cause 10 points of
damage. When your skill is 60, you would be doing 30 damage for a
successful strike. If peope think this is too much, start the skill at 1
point instead of 20.

This one skill would go long in making the warrior more viable with the
hybrid classes.

Angarth, Warrior of the 17th Tier
"Periissem ni periisem"
